claim: Color of Night came out in 1994.

supporting.text: According to IMDb, 'Color of Night' was released on October 28, 1994.

attacks.text: According to IMDb, 'Color of Night' was released on October 28, 1994.
IMDb is not a reliable source for film release dates because user-submitted data can contain inaccuracies.
The actual release date of 'Color of Night' was 1995 based on archived box office reports from Variety magazine.
IMDb cross-references data with official studio announcements and industry databases to ensure accuracy.
Variety magazine's box office reports often reflect theatrical release windows rather than exact premiere dates.
User-submitted data on IMDb lacks formal verification processes and is prone to deliberate misinformation.
Theatrical release windows in Variety reports may align with regional premieres rather than global official dates.

supporting.text: The film's production timeline aligns with a 1994 release, as filming concluded in early 1994.

attacks.text: The film's production timeline aligns with a 1994 release, as filming concluded in early 94.
Filming completion in early 1994 does not confirm the release date; post-production work could have delayed it.
The production timeline cited lacks verifiable evidence from official studio records.
Other films with similar production schedules were released in different years, indicating no strict correlation.
Post-production work is typically completed before release; most films follow a strict schedule to meet deadlines.
Studio records from 1994 confirm the film's production timeline and release coordination.
The comparison to other films is flawed due to differences in distribution strategies and market timing.
Post-production delays were common in 1994 due to technical constraints, contradicting the assumption of strict scheduling.
Studio records from 1994 were often incomplete or altered for marketing purposes, reducing their reliability.
Distribution strategies in 1994 were standardized across studios, making cross-film comparisons valid.

supporting.text: Box office records from 1994 list 'Color of Night' as a notable film of that year.

attacks.text: Box office records from 1994 list 'Color of Night' as a notable film of that year.
Box office records from 1994 may include films released in previous years that gained popularity later.
The term 'notable' in box office records does not necessarily confirm the film's release year.
Box office data can be misattributed to years due to reporting errors or delayed releases.
Reputable box office databases like Box Office Mojo explicitly track release dates alongside annual rankings.
Film historians define 'notable' based on critical reception and cultural impact tied to its original release.
Reporting errors in box office data are statistically rare for major studio releases like 'Color of Night'.
Independent verification shows 'Color of Night' was actually released in 1995 according to IMDb archives.
Critical reception metrics from 1994 do not align with a film released in a later year.
IMDb's release date listings are more reliable than box office tracking systems for chronological accuracy.

supporting.text: The movie's soundtrack album was registered with the Copyright Office in 1994.

attacks.text: The movie's soundtrack album was registered with the Copyright Office in 1994.
Copyright registration date does not necessarily indicate movie release date.

The Copyright Office registration is not proof of release year.
Official Copyright Office records are legally binding and confirm production timelines.
The specific details of this registration align with the original theatrical release.
Registration documentation explicitly states it pertains to the film's original soundtrack.
Legal records may reflect delayed filings rather than actual release dates.
Re-releases often require separate copyright registrations with distinct dates.
Registration metadata lacks explicit confirmation of theatrical release year.

supporting.text: The film's director, Robert Rippberger, cited its release as part of his career milestones in 1994 interviews.

attacks.text: The film's director, Robert Rippberger, cited its release as part of his career milestones in 1994 interviews.

Studio records from 1994 confirm the film's release date as 1994.
